name: Command
documentation:
Base class for commands sent to the Fluxzero Runtime.

A {@code Command} represents a request to perform a state-changing operation on the Runtime, such as indexing a document, deleting entries, or creating audit trails.

All commands inherit from {@link Request} and are assigned a unique {@link #requestId} to support correlation and observability.

Each command defines a {@link #getGuarantee()} which indicates how delivery or storage of the command should be handled (e.g. whether to wait until it's stored).

Optionally, a {@link #routingKey()} may be provided to direct the command to a specific processing node or partition based on a domain-specific identifier (such as a document or collection ID). This helps with consistent hashing or sharding of work in the Runtime. @see Guarantee @see Request

methods.name: getGuarantee
methods.documentation:
Indicates the delivery guarantee required for this command.

 @return the {@link Guarantee} level (e.g. {@code STORED}, {@code SENT}, {@code NONE})

methods.name: routingKey
